Author: Xu, B.; Yüksel, C.; Abur, A.; Akleman, E.
Title: 3D visualization of power system state estimation
Publication Title: IEEE Melecon 2006
research_application: software tool is an upgraded version of the existing software package, Power Education Toolbox (PET) which is previously developed in Texas A&M University for educational purposes. The new interface is developed in C++ using FLTK (Fast Light Tool Kit).
evaluation: different scenarios tested for effectiveness using IEEE 118 bus system
layout: split screen even - left is edit and right is view window
node_representation: buses in edit mode as stars and towers in view mode
purpose: identifiable characteristics related to violations of various operating limits; illustrate deficiencies associated with the existing metering system both from the point of view of metering design as well as accuracy
tasks: test scenrios
interactivity: edit window allows user to add, move, delete buses and lines in 2D; view window shows 3D viz; pan or zoom in/out in these two windows to locate the point of interest in the system; dialog box for info on demand
energy_data_type: power flow and state estimationl voltage; phase angle
Notes: Software package designed to aid power operators estimate the state of the system or conduct power system analysis; Animation used to represent direction and amount of line flows; In power flow analysis mode, animation and bus contouring technique is used for visualizing power flows and bus voltages. In state estimation mode, color contour is used to visualize different observable islands and bad measurements which are identified through the largest normalized residuals test

Author: Venkatesh, A.; Cokkinides, G.; Meliopoulos, A. P. S.
Title: 3D-visualization of power system data using triangulation and subdivision techniques
Publication Title: Proceedings of the 42nd Annual Hawaii International Conference on System Sciences, HICSS
research_application: visualisation scheme application in Visual C++ and OpenGL
evaluation: no evaluation
time_period: animation of the 3D surface can be generated for continuous readings received from the sites to view quantities and observe them over a period of time.
purpose: visualization scheme based on triangulation and subdivision techniques for presenting large sets of geographically dispersed power system data - e.g. locate regions where voltage above threshold
tasks: identify regtions with interesting readings
interactivity: user can click on disks to see which part of the network they are on (not mentioned what the disks are)
energy_data_type: voltage magnitude; voltage phase; reactive power flow; real power flow; electric current
Notes: Proposed viz scheme can be used to identify specific regions with interesting readings for various power system qtys - voltage magnitude, voltage phase, reactive power flow, real power flow, current etc. Animation can be introduced; More general alerting style viz rather than specific

Author: Shrestha, N. R.; Sherpa, P. T.; Gurung, S.; Chapagain, K.; Mallik, B.; Pokhrel, B. R.
Title: A Custom Developed Flexible Tool for Real-Time Distribution Grid Visualization
Publication Title: 2024 IEEE 33rd International Symposium on Industrial Electronics (ISIE)
research_application: platform using open-source Python libraries PyPSA, folium - program run and HTML generate for user - refreshed every minute
evaluation: methodology compared with DigSILENT PowerFactory software and load flow results compared - eval not vis
node_representation: circles for bus colour by voltage magniture
time_period: near real-time - uses historical metered data
purpose: enhance situational awareness and assists distribution utilities in better decision-making
target_user: help non-tech personnel who can take part in decision-making process
tasks: identify critical points in network e.g. overloaded lines and buses who voltage magnitude deviate
interactivity: map can be magnifined or panned, use can click on bus and popup will appear with per unit voltage magnitude and voltage angle of the bus. Click on lines for active and reactive power flow
energy_data_type: voltage magnitude, voltage angle of bus; reactive and active power flow of lines
Notes: Distribution grid with buses mapped - uses colour hue for buses and lines - for non-tech users

Author: Chin, G.; McGary, B.; Pierce, K.; Woo, J.; Rabello, R.; Chen, Y.
Title: A dynamic contingency analysis visualization tool
Publication Title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
research_application: web browser based vis tool that displays outputs from Dynamic Contigency Analysis Tool (DCAT) - new feature of DCAT package
evaluation: usability evaulation to test effectivness of the tool with 2 power grid engineers who was familiar eith the project
layout: interactive tables and charts on left, and full geo map right that changes with settings menu
node_representation: Load buses are represented as rectangles, generators as upside-down triangles, and unknown nodes as circles. Nodes in violation of their normal voltages are red, while nodes not in violation are gray.
link_representation: varying thickness - thicker lines have ouer colour to indicate current flow within transmission line compared to its line rating (inner colour)
purpose: simulate events to see how specific contigency will unfold - e.g. hurricane event
tasks: quickly capture and comprehend critical info, simulate events - For the South Carolina hurricane use case, the analyst would select that hurricane event as shown in Fig. 4. Then a scenario must be chosen. Some example scenarios are: Taking no corrective action, a limited action, or a major corrective action when a contingency occurs. Each contingency consists of steps and snapshots. A step is a system break such as a power line going down or a node going offline. Snapshots are the corrective actions made and their cascading effects. DVT visualizes and animates these steps and snapshots.
interactivity: select events, scenario; interactive tables linked to map, map zoomable
energy_data_type: bus voltage, generator (MW), line rating (kV), extent of voltage violation (pu), generator frequency (Hz) , branch flow (MW)
Notes: Web-based app to simulate contingencies and has animation, playback capabilities and time series charts - novel presentation only, not novel vis

Author: Aksoy, S. G.; Purvine, E.; Cotilla-Sanchez, E.; Halappanavar, M.
Title: A generative graph model for electrical infrastructure networks
Publication Title: Journal of complex networks
research_application: generative graph model for electrical infrastructure netowrks
evaluation: model’s performance by comparing its output across many runs to the aforementioned real data
purpose: better failitate application of network science tools to power grid - algorithm useful to generat power grid graphs in light of limited real power grid data. The analysis of topological structure of a grid can assist in vulnerability analysis, controlled islananding, locational marginal pricing and the location of sensors
interactivity: user specify number of vertices of a given voltage level
energy_data_type: vertex has a nominal voltage rating, and each edge is either a power transmission line (connecting two vertices of the same voltage) or transformer edge (connecting vertices of different voltage levels).
Notes: Takes view that power network is a 'network-of-networks' composed of vertex or edge homogenous subgraphs - That is, power grid graphs consist of a collection of samevoltage subgraphs for each voltage level, which are connected to each other via transformer edges. Focuses on physical connections on network rather than dynamics of power flow

Author: Antic, T.; Capuder, T.
Title: A geographic information system-based modelling, analysing and visualising of low voltage networks: The potential of demand time-shifting in the power quality improvement
Publication Title: Applied energy
research_application: open source tool for processing and editing GIS and smart meter data; QGIS used to vis results, Python and SQL used for analysis and communication between 2 systems
evaluation: no evaluation
purpose: improvement and planning and operation of smart distribution networks to prevent power quality disturbances
tasks: monitor consumption patterns and identify changes
interactivity: tool still requires you to edit data and process it
Notes: QGIS tool with some python scvripts that clean up the GIS data

Author: Lundstrom, B.; Gotseff, P.; Giraldez, J.; Coddington, M.
Title: A High-Speed, Real-Time Visualization and State Estimation Platform for Monitoring and Control of Electric Distribution Systems: Implementation and Field Results
Publication Title: 2015 IEEE Power & Energy Society General Meeting
research_application: distribution system state estimation (DSSE) web platform implemented using open source software and distribution system monitoring hardware - HTML and Processing.js
evaluation: DSSE module was validated using a set of eight DMUs implemented in the real-world system; field implemnetation used to demonstrate the real-time state estimation and visualization platform includes a set of 12 DMUs
layout: split screen: scrolling strip charts of key measurements and an annotated, GIS-based, circuit map showing the overview of voltage and power flow conditions in the system.
node_representation: circle for each metering point coloured by live data status
time_period: 25s per chart and scrolls in real time
purpose: purpose built interface for visualising the entire state of a distribution sytstem using live data - provides critical at-a-glance understanding of how a distribitio system is operating in real-time
interactivity: drop down menus for user selection, hover on GIS map with pop up box of numerical values voltage, real power and reactive power
energy_data_type: voltage and power flow, real and reactive power
Notes: Web-based vis of disrtibution system, has live strips charts but looks like a line chart, not sure how the complete vis looks - reinforced the need for more distribution level vis that is not just focuses on a single home or building, or limited info such as just fault locations

Author: Kouveliotis-Lysikatos, I.; Marin, M.; Olason, J.; Amelin, M.; Söder, L.
Title: A Network Aggregation Tool for the Energy System Modelling Framework Spine
Publication Title: 2020 International Conference on Smart Energy Systems and Technologies (SEST)
research_application: software app tool that performs a multi-area spatial network aggregation based on the generalized Radial Equivalent Independent (REI) - opertes in Julia and Python (vis) environment
evaluation: assessed for different IEEE test systems - but doesn't specify further
purpose: integrated in Spine (energy modelling framework for planning European energy grids)
Notes: Network reduction technique - nned to look into why this is beneficial

Author: NAGENDRA RAO, P. S.; Deekshit, R.
Title: A novel algorithm for automatic generation of one-line diagrams of distribution feeders
Publication Title: Electric power components and systems
research_application: algorithm for automatically generating readable oneline diagrams of radial distribution feeders
evaluation: applied on practical feeders to test algorithm but not tested on usability of drawing
link_representation: straight line - algorithm makes all distance lengths the same and then adjusts for overlaps
geography_representation: abstract- only terminal node coordinate known
purpose: planning and operation of distribution networks
tasks: NA
Notes: Layout algorithm for distribution feeders

Author: Pei, S.; Huang, X.; Sheng, B.; Ma, L.; Wu, D.; Li, P.
Title: A Novel Visualization Method of Power Transmission Lines
Publication Title: 2015 IEEE International Conference on Multimedia Big Data
research_application: algorithm that includes placement of nodes radially after k-means clustering
evaluation: experiments are based on the dataset of the power transmission lines of Zhangjiajie City in China
geography_representation: abstract- core scheduling node designed at center of visual topology
purpose: visualization method can more clearly show the topological structure of the current power transmission lines and retain the main geographical location information; balance substation density of map and optimises aesthetic qualities
tasks: NA
Notes: Algorithm that adjusts node locations and drawing lines - places scheduling node at center and other ring around it - completely neglects geo position info and distance and direction of lines but potentially ok for separatingnodes that are close to other other

Author: Wong, P.C.; Schneider,K.; Mackey, P.; Foote, H.; Chin Jr., G.; Guttromson, R.; Thomas, J.
Title: A Novel Visualization Technique for Electric Power Grid Analytics
Publication Title: IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics
research_application: software; ongoing collaboration between the US Department of Energy (DOE), the National Visualization and Analytics Center (NVAC) [20], the Electricity Infrastructure Operations Center (EIOC) [6] at PNNL, and partners from the electric power industry
evaluation: assessed against the current geographic-based power grid visualization for the North American Electricity Infrastructure; usability evaluation of GreenGrid with participants from PNNL- derived seven network analysis problems that participants were to solve by analyzing electric power grid data using a traditional geographic layout and a GreenGrid layout.
layout: GreenGrid layout as well as geographic layout
node_representation: circle weighted using a energy value e.g. voltage phase angle
network_layout: weighted graph layout to model the physics of underlying grid
purpose: planning and monitoring of the North American Electricity Infrastructure; capabability includes quickly identifying where the system would be mostly likely to separate if an uncontrolled islanding event were to occur.
tasks: tasks in table 3 of paper
interactivity: selecting nodes and edges, bringing up and viewing node and edge metadata, and panning across and zooming into and out of the graph.
energy_data_type: A node in a GreenGrid weighted graph can represent parameters such as voltage or load (power delivered by a power station or transformer), whereas a link can show impedance or power loss. Multiple parameters can be combined using different weight proportions. Potential node weighting factors include: voltage magnitude, voltage angle, real power injection, reactive power injection, real load, reactive load, and so forth. Potential link weighting factors include: resistance, reactance, impedance, real power flow, reactive power flow, real losses, reactive losses, and so forth
Notes: CORE I: GreenGird. Multiple representations of graph structure that is linked [S <- G] (space as a base representation) combo, colour coding base voltage onto nodes; GreenGrid is a vis info systme for planning and monitoring the power grid - power station and transformers are the nodes, transmission system are the edges. Moves away from a traditional geographic information system (GIS) design approach and toward the understanding of the power grid’s physics

Author: Omer, M.; Idowu, P.
Title: A Software Visualization Tool for Power Systems Analysis
Publication Title: 2009 Annual Conference & Exposition
research_application: software vis tool first developed in GUIDE in MATLAB and then in C#
evaluation: pilot version of the visualization was distributed to a group of six students and young engineers - 3 practice assingments with questionanaries re effectivenss of the tool
purpose: response to the urgent need for newer, more efficient educational tools to reform the outlook of power engineering education - analysis concepts visualization tool consists of simulation applications that focus on three problems: load flow, economic dispatch, and unit commitment; enables students to visualize the effects of changes in the power system configuration and to observe the flow of information through the immediate steps
tasks: add/remove buses or lines, input line paramenters, real and reactive load levels, voltage of generatorion buses (pu)
energy_data_type: line paramenters, real and reactive load levels, voltage of generatorion buses (pu)
Notes: Software vis tool for power analysis in undergrad electrical engineering course enables students to visualize the effects of changes in the power system configuration and to observe the flow of information through the immediate steps. Focises on 3 tasks: three problems: load flow, economic dispatch, and unit commitment.

Author: Hussain, A.; Aslam, M.; & Arif, S. M.
Title: A standards-based approach for Auto-drawing single line diagram of multivendor smart distribution systems
Publication Title: International Journal of Electrical Power & Energy Systems
evaluation: several test case studies have been conducted to verify the robustness, flexibility, and effectiveness of the proposed technique
purpose: control and monitoring for fault location, identification, separation and service restoration; , protection coordination, and optimization can be achieved easily, topology recognition
Notes: CORE II: Technique for the auto-drawing of single line diagram (SLD) of multivendor distribution systems based on a ternary tree and collision avoidance algorithm

Author: Overbye, T.J.; Klump, R.P.; Weber, J.D.
Title: A virtual environment for interactive visualization of power system economic and security information
Publication Title: 1999 IEEE Power Engineering Society Summer Meeting. Conference Proceedings (Cat. No.99CH36364)
research_application: PowerWorld Simulator modified to allow 3D drawing and interaction using OpenGL
technology: PC, mouse and keyboard for control
evaluation: no evaluation
link_representation: straight line with directional arrows and varying thickness of lines
purpose: use a VE to interactively visualize more abstract power system data. VEs for power system visualization as a supplement to, not a replacement of, existing techniques such as two-dimensional one-line diagrams and tabular-type displays
energy_data_type: bus generator reactive reserves, voltage magniture, ATC, generation reserves, MW marginal costs
Notes: CORE I: 3D virtual environment of network using modified PowerWorld Simulator

Author: Mitra, J.; Benidris, M.; Nguyen, N.; Deb, S.
Title: A Visualization Tool for Real-Time Dynamic Contingency Screening and Remedial Actions
Publication Title: IEEE Transactions on Industry Applications
evaluation: case studies tested on real SoCal Edison (SCE) sysytem
layout: map main window on left (60%), with list of actions on right panel: screen is divided into four parts: (1) the map showing the measurements, (2) a window shows system status, (3) a window shows the current contingencies if there is any, and (4) a window shows the a list possible future contingencies that are ranked according to their impact for preventive actions.
purpose: enables the user to constantly analyze the system status through monitoring bus angle, frequenc y, and voltage as well as power flow on the lines on a single line diagram.
tasks: enable intiating control actions (ine tripping, load shedding , generation reschedulin) from suggested remedial actions by the tool
interactivity: zoom, pan, observe data in tabula form, hover on line
energy_data_type: bus angle, frequency, voltage, power flow
Notes: CORE II: Interactive real-time vis tool with remedial actions recommended - LRAS system

Author: Romero-Gómez, R.; Diez, D.
Title: Alarm Trend Catcher: Projecting Operating Conditions in the Electrical Power Grid Domain with Interactive Alarm Visualization
Publication Title: Proceedings of the XVII International Conference on Human Computer Interaction
evaluation: user study with 12 participants - grad students of HCI to assess usability of Alarm Trend Catcher
layout: screen with 4 split even split - coordinate virws
geography_representation: both node and and lines mapped
purpose: projecting ahead the infrastructure state in real time by managing alarms - currently role of operator to estimate alarm's relevance and evolution in time; assisting operators to perform projection tasks in real-time electric power grid operation.
tasks: (Task 1) identify the grid area with higher number of alarm activations; (Task 2) identify the specific period of time with higher number of alarm activations; (Task 3) identify the specific period of time with higher number of high-priority alarms; and (Task 4) identify the type of high-priority alarms.
energy_data_type: discharges in transformers, and isolation of incidents in medium and low-level voltage lines
Notes: CORE I: Alarm vis appaorach aimed at assisting the perceptioj of upcoming alarmans but also the projection of future state of the electic grid - designed after semi-structured interviews with domain experts and direct observations from control room operators

Author: Lendák, I.; Erdeljan, A.; Rudas, I.
Title: Algorithm for adaptive Smart Grid visualization
Publication Title: 2013 IEEE International Conference on Industrial Technology (ICIT)
evaluation: tested on real-life distrbution system of up to 100 objects and generated visually pleaseing one-line
purpose: various zoom levels of the algorithm shows only the important objects
target_user: dispatchers, engineers, asset managers (need info about each piece of equipment)
Notes: CORE II: algorithm which automatically generates adaptive one-line diagrams of large distribution systems - has various zoom levels - uses divide-and-conquer and branch-and-bound - more scalable as can visualise feeders that are relatively dense

Author: Kova?ev, N.; Lendák, I.
Title: Algorithm for distribution substation area visualization
Publication Title: 2014 IEEE 15th International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Informatics (CINTI)
evaluation: tested on multiple distribution substation areas exported from three different real life (European) distribution network models diagram and assessment formula specifically developed by the authors for measuring the quality of the generated one line diagrams.
network_layout: orthogonal - algorithm arranges feeders around supply station
purpose: alternative to creation of one line diagrams that is not labour intensive and requiring of maintenance in SCADA
Notes: one line diagram generation algorithm (2 iterative steps) capable of drawing multiple feeders supplied by a single (electric power) distribution substation; algorithm is not yet capable of handling meshed networks, i.e. inter-connected feeders; can;t hangle multiple substation areas in a single diagram. ignored geo layout of elements

Author: Kova?ev, N.; Gavri?, M.; Lendák, I;
Title: Algorithm for visualizing substation areas in electric power systems
Publication Title: Expert Systems with Applications
research_application: algorithm - diagram export in the industry-standard CIMXML forma
evaluation: algorithm was tested on 2510 different substation areas of various complexity extracted from the network models of real-life, European distribution systems; novel evaluation procedure and verified with a human domain experts on a subset of the resulting diagrams.
purpose: min human intevention in generating usable diagrams in newly built supervisory control systems
target_user: electric power system operator (dispatchers), SCADA vendors
Notes: Algorithm capable of generating visually-pleasing diagrams of substation areas consisting of a single hub node and a complex network of thousands of interconnected elements (feeders)- extension of previous work (kovacev2014) - It advances the state of the art by being (1) the first to visualize weakly-meshed substation areas with up to 2000 points with low time complexity, (2) via the inclusion of a generic diagram quality assessment formula capable to measure the quality of any OLD, as well as (3) by sharing a rich data set consisting of 2510 substation areas extracted from the models of multiple European electric power distribution systems.

Author: Kova?ev, N.; Lendák, I.
Title: Algorithms for drawing weakly meshed distribution substation areas
Publication Title: 2016 IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics (SMC)
evaluation: The algorithm was tested on multiple (21), weakly meshed distribution substation areas extracted from several different European-style distribution network models. It generated visually pleasing oneline diagrams for systems with more than 1000 objects. The quality of the generated one-line diagrams was assessed by a formula, which took into account different characteristics, e.g. diagram area, total edge length, number of crossings.
purpose: replace manually drawn OLDs as size and complexity of network increases
Notes: Algorithm for one-line diagram generation of multiple interconnected, i.e. weakly meshed, feeders supplied by one distribution substation - optimal feeder order determined by genetic algorithm (GA)

Author: Maricar, N. M.; Shahidehpour, S. M
Title: An engineering analysis tool in power system using object-oriented graphical integrator
Publication Title: Proceedings. National Power Engineering Conference, 2003. PECon 2003
research_application: windows GUI app that displays data entry for integration into power system applications - C++
evaluation: NA
purpose: make decision making process faster; one-line diagram drawing, data entry, database storage, graphical display of engineering analysis results; designed for short-term uit commitment
tasks: Design mode: Creating new networks diagram , Editing the existing network diagram Operation mode: System Administration
energy_data_type: bus, generator, load branch, transmission line
Notes: Black and white images hard to see viz; Describe a unique Windows GUI application that enable the user to draw a one-line diagram, enter bus and device parameters through dialog box into power system database, and simulate engineering analyis using vis

Author: Maricar, N. M.; Shahidehpour, S. M
Title: An object-oriented graphical representation for engineering network analysis in power system
Publication Title: 2003 IEEE Power Engineering Society General Meeting (IEEE Cat. No. 03CH37491)
evaluation: NA
layout: multiple views concurrently but unspecified layout of views
purpose: diffcult to visualize an electrical network by examining tabular data output. Converting the data into computer graphic presentations has solved many similar problems. The user will be able to discover problem in the network much faster and easier than traditional methods have previously allowed and optimize task performance
tasks: input data structure
Notes: Black and white images hard to see viz; discusses concepts of power system analysis presentation that represents network as digraph

Author: Dezhou, Y.; Changhai, Y.; Kun, C.; Zhou, W.
Title: Application of Google Earth in Power Network Planning
Publication Title: 2019 IEEE International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Applications (ICAICA)
research_application: process using mutliple applications including GE
evaluation: Deyang Nanxing 220kV substation 110 kV supporting project used as an example
purpose: understand planning landscape to inspire planning and design of power grid
interactivity: zoom level 6-18, circle selection, rotation and clicking; display basic info of grid structure , voltage level
Notes: Presents a vis process using  Google Earth satellite map to is power network planning - but weakly describes the benefits of GE to planning

Author: Liu, Z. G.; Wang, S. X.
Title: Application of Virtual Visualization in Smart Power Distribution System
Publication Title: Advanced Materials Research
research_application: web program: ArcGIS as the development platform, ESRI CityEngine 2011 and Google SketchUp as the 3D modeling software.
evaluation: no evaluation
purpose: help operators understand operational status of current ystem more conveninently so they can deal with operation problems more effectively
interactivity: map has the zoom, roam and drag features
energy_data_type: doesn’t say but assume can attach values to vis elements
Notes: 3D power distribution system allowing for simulation of the transmission lines, electrical equipment, power distribution stations, and distributed generators - doesn’t talk about what user can do with vis

Author: Johnson, G.; Molnar, S.; Brunhart-Lupo, N.; Gruchalla, K.
Title: Architecture for Web-Based Visualization of Large-Scale Energy Domains
Publication Title: 2024 IEEE Workshop on Energy Data Visualization (EnergyVis)
evaluation: multiple use cases
purpose: growing scale and complexity of multi-domain data for modern energy systems underscores the need for high-resolution visualization systems that can facilitate the necessary analysis and management for making decisions with this data; shown increased user performance on spatial tasks, mental mapping, and memory on large-scale high-resolution displays compared to traditional desktop displays, even when controlling for visual angles between the display types
tasks: view the display
energy_data_type: allows for varied data to be styles
Notes: Architectural design, development, and application of a high-resolution web-based visualization environment capable of cross-domain analysis of tens of millions of energy assets, focusing on scalability and performance; web-based architecture that supports a 100-megapixel high-resolution large display wall for direct visualization of these multi-domain datasets

Author: Jin, S.; Abhyankar, S.
Title: ChatGrid: Power Grid Visualization Empowered by a Large Language Model
Publication Title: 2024 IEEE Workshop on Energy Data Visualization (EnergyVis)
research_application: vis web tool using Deck.gl and Chart.js
evaluation: no evaluation
purpose: extract patterns, monitor and optimize the performance of modern power grids in an increasingly dynamic and efficient manner. power grid, is challenging due to several aspects from large-scale geography, visual clutter, cognitive overload, and even the learning curve of the visualization tool
target_user: operators, planners, power utilities, researchers, and policymakers,
tasks: ask questions via query based interfacy
interactivity: type queries - tool can retrieving values, filtering, computing derived values, finding extremums, sorting, determining ranges, and characterizing distributions
energy_data_type: can be used for visualizing power flow or AC optimal power flow results from other analysis tools through creating appropriate input files.
Notes: CORE I: method of querying network data - ChatGrid an interactive geospatial visualization of large-scale transmission networks using natural language quert interface produced by ChatGPT -

Author: Hu, J.; Sankar, L.; Mir, D. J.
Title: Cluster-and-Connect: An algorithmic approach to generating synthetic electric power network graphs
Publication Title: 2015 53rd Annual Allerton Conference on Communication, Control, and Computing (Allerton)
evaluation: accuracy of the proposed model is evaluated by comparing the synthetic models generated for specific real electric network graphs
purpose: smaller number of traditionally available test systems, such as the IEEE bus systems, have been largely deemed to be insufficient for supporting large simulation studies and commercial-grade algorithm development. electric power networks are owned in part by different regional transmission networks, making it unrealistic to assume that these competing entities will share their exact regional topologies. However, competing entities might be more willing to share synthetic graphs
Notes: Algotirhm that generates synthetic networks using unique topological properties of electrical power networks

Author: Oh, S.; Jang, G.; Moon, S. I.
Title: Commercial off-the-shelf-based development of a power system data visualisation service platform
Publication Title: IET generation, transmission & distribution
evaluation: Korean power system visualised in the VSP as example
layout: split screen to show different levels of network
geography_representation: mapped substations, transmission lines and power plants
purpose: developed to expand visualisation capability of a commercial power flow analysis program whwich is usually in plain text or tabular form - requires a lot of training and experience
tasks: monitor radar over network
energy_data_type: voltage represented by line width and colour; bus voltage magnitude/ angle, branch flow, and the generator output data from the power system analysis module are displayed in plain text
Notes: visualisation service platform that integrates weather, lightning, and power system data into 2D and 3D visualisation environments with geographic information are presented.

Author: Bush, B.; Brunhart-Lupo, N.; Bugbee, B.; Krishnan, V.; Potter, K.; Gruchalla, K.
Title: Coupling visualization, simulation, and deep learning for ensemble steering of complex energy models
Publication Title: 2017 IEEE Workshop on Data Systems for Interactive Analysis (DSIA)
evaluation: no evaluation
purpose: energy system simulations - likely be used in planning, quick-response, and quality assurance activities
target_user: energy researchers, site planners and leaderhship
tasks: evaluate planning scenarios
interactivity: walking inside a virtual campus, see the effects of various settings, and spawn new simulation runs via headset
Notes: framework that allows users to explore and steer ensembles of energy systems simulations by coupling multiple energy models and interactive visualization through a dataflow API; uses headset; -framework for visualization-driven design, exploration, and analysis of energy simulations. Reneweable energy planning only an applucation of the framework

Author: Overbye, T. J.; Wert, J.; Shetye, K. S.; Safdarian, F.; Birchfield, A. B.
Title: Delaunay Triangulation Based Wide-Area Visualization of Electric Transmission Grids
Publication Title: 2021 IEEE Kansas Power and Energy Conference (KPEC)
evaluation: results demo on 4 example systems ranging in sixe from 7 buses to 82,000
node_representation: rectangle or GDV object proportionated to area's generation and colour based on MW exports
link_representation: straight line with flow arrows dynamically sized thickness
geography_representation: somewhat geographic, can be mapped nodes at small scale or mapped nodes using geo grid
purpose: for situation awareness in eng - applications include power flow, contingency analysis, sensitivity analysis, optimal power flow, time-domain simulations- purpose of ppaper focuses on aspect of SA associated with user understanding overall state of large-scale electric grid
tasks: observation?
interactivity: flow details available by right-clicking, zoom and pan
Notes: CORE I: Delaunay triangulation based technique for visualising flows in high voltage electric grids - buses first aggregated into groups than Delaunau triangulation used to create planar graph, followed by mapping of the transmission line flows onto the graph

Author: He, Y.; Zhang, Y.; Fang, C.; Huang, K.; Han, X.
Title: Design and implementation of real-time power grid webgis visualization framework based on new generation dispatching and control system
Publication Title: Journal of Physics: Conference Series
evaluation: used on East China Power Grid
Notes: WebGIS framework providing implementation of front-end and back-end deployment for power grid network display - includes geo base layer, power grid network layer, external environment and weather layer and power grid ops layer

Author: Wu, Y.K.; Lee, X.C.; Hu, C.Y.; Su, P.E.
Title: Design of Visualization Interface for Transmission Congestions
Publication Title: Energy Procedia
evaluation: applied to Taiwan power system
layout: split display, left map with network overlay (50%), right side has N0 ans N1 tab and drop down selections and data displays - linked
node_representation: circles for bus colour by voltage magniture
time_period: meant for real-time - measured data recorded every 20 mins
purpose: help system operators understand real-time operating conditions and determine potential schedules for generation and transmisison system
tasks: identify congestion, search for generator/substation and its detail, switch modes between normal and contingency state
Notes: CORE II: vis interface that displays the transmission system congestions for N-0 steady-state or N-1 contingency cases - also aids operators in identifying the cause of possible line congestions and reschedule generators or transmission lines.

Author: Chen, H.; Mo, J.; Kothapa, U.; Bhargava, B.; Dyer, J
Title: Development of an on-line synchrophasor wide area dynamics monitoring platform
Publication Title: 2014 IEEE PES T&D Conference and Exposition
evaluation: no evaluation
layout: Multiple profiles can be configured using combination of displays which can be used by different user roles, for instance, operators, operating engineers and planning engineers
time_representation: single frame  on map, but charts have temporal axis
time_period: real-time, has historial playback but no forecast
purpose: realt-time reliability monitoring, analysis and alarming - common reasons for these blackouts is believed to be the lack of wide area situational awareness in the grid
target_user: operatorsoperators, reliability coordinators, operating and planning engineers
tasks: personalise display for profile, peronalise map layers in term of visibility, order and opacity, enable cluster manager so that PMUs can be grouped based on geo distance, identify source of issues via alarm grid view, review streamed data
interactivity: charts, maps, variety of layers, alarms and incident indicators can be configured individually and assembled as a single tab (named display). Multiple displays can be grouped to form a profile. Zoom on map, cluster PMUs, click on map, create annotations, pause dispay, replay
Notes: CORE I: Manually added in Covidence- Real-Time Dynamics Monitoring System (RTDMS®) Platform for real-time reliability monitoring, analysis and alarming from synchrophasor measurement; RTDMS Platform is a comprehensive portfolio of software applications for providing wide-area situational awareness, real-time dynamics monitoring, as well as performance and event analysis of the power grid for use by operators, reliability coordinators, operating and planning engineers

Author: He, B.; Mo, W. X.; Hu, J. X.; Yang, G.; Lu, G. J.; Liu, Y. Q.
Title: Development of power grid Web3D GIS based on Cesium
Publication Title: 2016 IEEE PES Asia-Pacific Power and Energy Engineering Conference (APPEEC)
evaluation: no evaluation
node_representation: modelled transformer pole, no detail of smaller substation
purpose: promote system development and upgrades - observe and analyse data from multiple angles
tasks: view network in 3D, creare animators, analyse power, 3D roaming
interactivity: zoom, rotate, move 3D objects along a predetermined route.
Notes: visualization method based on Cesium and 3DCityDB to achieve panorama visualization of power data in 3D virtual environment on desktop

Author: Sloman, I. G.; Benedicenti, L.
Title: Displaying the state of an electric system: A preliminary study
Publication Title: Canadian Conference on Electrical and Computer Engineering, 2005
evaluation: SaskPower’s electric grid was used as a case study
node_representation: circles for bus colour by voltage magniture
link_representation: lines originally following geo and then distroted
purpose: system overview display could overt power failures if electric grid system operators have been fully informed of the state of their system - When major or even moderate system disturbances occur, the current interface produces too many alarms and provides too much detail, as a result the big picture of what is happening on the system can be lost
target_user: system operators and network reliability engineers
Notes: vis displays include both a non-distorted view of the whole grid accompanied by a number of sub views of congested areas and a distorted lens view of the whole electric grid, incorporating the congested areas. The non-distorted view is based on a ‘highway map’ paradigm with the ‘highway map’ being the whole grid, with the congested areas being shown as ‘street maps’.

Author: Abdel-Akher, M., El-Nemr, M. K.; Abdel-Galil, W
Title: Distributed interactive power system simulator using Web technology
Publication Title: 2010 IEEE International Conference on Power and Energy
evaluation: no evaluation
layout: main window is the SLD, side bars with bus details and bottom table line details
purpose: evaluate system behavior for planning and operation - engineers implement system modeling and simulation techniques during analysis, design and learning processes; suitable for electrical engineering educational applications and at the same time it can be extended for industry application in online operation.
tasks: learning about system
interactivity: user provides commands such as create new object, delete and edit through methods calls; user is able to edit component attributes such that change and update electrical network variables for the developed power system elements; drag and drop technique to move, rotate or delete power system elements on the drawing area
energy_data_type: bus voltage, line avtive power, reactive power
Notes: Web-based application designed to provide flexible, reliable and extendable power system simulator topology

Author: Li, X.; Feng, X.; Zeng, Z.; Xu, X.; Zhang, Y.
Title: Distribution feeder one-line diagrams automatic generation from geographic diagrams based on GIS
Publication Title: 2008 Third International Conference on Electric Utility Deregulation and Restructuring and Power Technologies
research_application: algorithm based on GIS platform (not mentioned)
evaluation: successfully demonstrated with some city district electrical distribution system but doesn't specify which cities
purpose: One-line diagrams automatic generation can adapt distribution system frequent switches operation and update network connection timely, as long as the real time switches status can obtained from SCADA
tasks: makle accurate decisions
Notes: distribution feeder one-line diagrams automatic generation from geographic diagrams based on GIS

Author: Liu, S.; Weng, D.; Tian, Y.; Deng, Z.; Xu, H.; Zhu, X.; Yin, H.; Zhan, X.; Wu, Y.
Title: ECoalVis: Visual Analysis of Control Strategies in Coal-fired Power Plants
Publication Title: IEEE Transactions on Visualization and Computer Graphics
evaluation: evaluated with two usage scenarios on a real-world historical dataset
layout: 4 linked panels display on one window
node_representation: hollow circles encode the control feedback sensors, while the solid ones encode the state sensors
purpose: o visually analyze the control strategies of coal-fired power plants. complex and dynamic environment inside the power plants, it is hard to extract and evaluate control strategies and their cascading impact across massive sensors. Three challenges were identified: a) interactive extraction of control strategies from large-scale dynamic sensor data, b) intuitive visual representation of cascading impact among the sensors in a complex power plant system, and c) time-lag-aware analysis of the impact of control strategies on electricity generation efficiency
tasks: R1: Extract the impact of control strategies with time series queries. R2: Identify responsible control strategies for anomalies in important sensors.R3: Explore the spatial propagation of control strategy impact. R4: Obtain the temporal cascading of control strategy impact. R5: Inspect the details of the sensor time series.
interactivity: There are three types of editing interactions for sensors , namely, insert, expand, and delete.We provide three aggregation interactions: sum, difference, and average. Filtering view for forward nd back analysis
network_level: hierarchical structure of a coal-fired power plant, which comprises three levels: components, units, and sensors. These components can be further divided into three stages, coal pulverization, burning, and steam circulation, based on the workflow of generating electricity from coal
energy_data_type: temperatures inside powerplant, control feedback such as valve openings
Notes: CORE III: dasboard about coal powerplants for control strategy of sensors; application to other energy industries other than electrical

Author: Kovacev, N.; Lendak, I.; Capko, D.; Erdeljan, A.
Title: Electric power distribution system visualization with graph partitioning
Publication Title: IEEE Africon 2013
evaluation: tested on partial, real life electric power distribution systems of up to 150 objects and it generated visually pleasing one-line diagrams
node_representation: square The coordinates of vertices representing high to medium voltage (HV/MV) substations were fixed
geography_representation: fixed high to medium voltage substation to coordinates, other no geo
purpose:
performs graph partioningn to reduce solution space
Even though the schematic views were completely digitized, their creation was still manual, i.e. an operator had to manually lay out each distribution transformer, pole mounted switch and line segment
tasks: run algorithm
Notes: Has good history of SLD evolutionL electric power distribution system (EPDS) visualization algorithm which performs graph partitioning before generating the visual representations, i.e. one line diagrams

Author: Lendák, I.; Vidács, A.; Erdeljan, A.
Title: Electric power system one-line diagram generation with branch and bound algorithm
Publication Title: 2012 IEEE International Energy Conference and Exhibition (ENERGYCON)
evaluation: tested both on test networks and real life feeders with multiple feed-in points and interconnects
geography_representation: HV substation placement should closely follow their geographical locations, e.g. if four substations supply a city center from north, east, south and west, then place them appropriately in the OLD,
purpose: alternative to manually drawn SLD
tasks: aid with fault restoration more efficiently
Notes: algorithm for automatic one-line diagram generation for power distribution systems - based on the classical divide and conquer algorithm as it divides the large graphs into smaller, more manageable parts, which are separately drawn by the branch and bound algorithm and combined into complete one-line diagrams

Author: Lendák, I.; Póth, M.; Capko, D.; Vukmirovic, S.; Erdeljan, A.
Title: Electric power system one-line diagram generation with genetic algorithm
Publication Title: IEEE 8th International Symposium on Intelligent Systems and Informatics
evaluation: The achieved results prove that one can generate graph drawings for radial graphs consisting of up to twenty nodes which comply with the above listed aesthetic criteria. Unfortunately the resulting graphs are not directly applicable in electric power system visualization as the algorithm requires further tweaking before it can lay out feeders in a suitable form
purpose: graphical representations convey info to dispatchers to quickly isolate faults, optimise operation, find weak spots
tasks: identify HV feeders approaching their limit/
Notes: algorithm for automatic one-line diagram generation based on the genetic algorithm (GA) - graph broken down to smaller components which are visualised separately and then assembled using the GA. Results here applicable to radial electrical distribution systems

Author: Lu, Q.; Xu, W.; Zhang, H.; Tang, Q.; Li, J.; Fang, R.
Title: ElectricVIS: visual analysis system for power supply data of smart city
Publication Title: The Journal of Supercomputing
evaluation: evaluated our system through case studies and analysis by power experts
layout: linked views display: ElectricVIS system: a dashboard view shows current city power situation information and provides some map control, b map view provides a visual summary of the geospatial environment, c the area overview view gives the load changes over time in the selected area of the user. d The hierarchical view shows the hierarchical trend of the power load in the current region. e Comparison view gives data comparison between different times
node_representation: dots distinguished by colour representing load
time_representation: single frame network but has time series data
time_period: 2 days used as time unit to save space
time_unit: Depends on view: Comparison view: Analysts can choose different time granularities and times to compare the current device power data
purpose: reduces the difficulty of understanding urban power supply situations; different visual views and interaction methods for interrelated hierarchical data in urban power data, which is critical for detecting the cause of anomalous data; help power experts effectively observe the city’s power supply situation and provide a variety of interactive means to help power experts discover and explore anomalous data in the system
tasks:
R1. Real-time display of power supply situation in a certain region
R2. Easy-to-understand display of multi-dimensional smart city power supply data
R3. Can explore different hierarchies of urban power supply data
interactivity: click on substation for more info
energy_data_type: power supply in smart grid; he hierarchical structure was divided into four parts, which showed: regional load change, high- and low-voltage level load change, substation detail load data and electricity type; real-time load, load change over time, frequency of overload and time
Notes: CORE I: ElectricVIS: dashboard for large-scale urban power supply data.

Author: Alemasoom, H.; Samavati, F.; Brosz, J.; Layzell, D.
Title: EnergyViz: an interactive system for visualization of energy systems
Publication Title: The Visual Computer International Journal of Computer Graphics
research_application: visualisation system that extends on linked sankey and map proposed in alemasoom2014 work
evaluation: evaluation with 2 groups of participants: first group was made up of two experts with solid background in energy systems who are also familiar with Sankey diagrams. The second group are eight graduate students with some background in energy systems and having little or no familiarity with Sankey diagram
node_representation: dot on map and rectangle bars of sankey diagram
time_representation: animation with historical data using slider
purpose: explore energy systems
target_user: energy system experts as well as a less experienced audience interested in exploring energy systems.
tasks: explore energy exchange and regional and domestic usage pattern tracking
interactivity: selecting nodes on map or sankey highlights flow, hovering on sankey and map, playback on time slider, refine options
energy_data_type: Domestic usage, production levels, imports, exports, energy loss and GHG emissions are examples of a node’s attributes
Notes: CORE I:Interface with linked views to explore Canada's energy system; Sankey diagram used to explore hierarchical data structure linked to map. 'The temporal property of an energy system is reflected as the change in its graph topology. Therefore, an energy system is indeed a dynamic network flow.' Linked to alemasoom2014

Author: Schneiders, C.; Vanzetta, J.; Verstege, J.F.
Title: Enhancement of Situation Awareness in Wide Area Transmission Systems for Electricity and Visualization of the Global System State
Publication Title: 2012 3rd IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Europe (ISGT Europe)
evaluation: First visualization approaches are implemented into the SCADA system of a German TSO - experiences gained by operators of the control centre will be used to validate and further enhance this concept.
layout: part of large display in control room
purpose: designed for congnitive task analysis and model for situation awareness to determine global system state in wide area electrical transmission system
tasks: operators to observe the global system state at a glance and enables intuitive situation awareness by improving visual perception like pattern recognition.
energy_data_type: security calculation with power flow security limit violation (current overloading),security calculation with voltage deviation,frequency deviation or information about system split,Area Control Error, is calculated as the sum of the power control error and the frequency control error, wind energy production, as an indicator for increased uncertainty regarding balancing and load flow situation and potential cause of high load flow situations, Power exchange program, the sum of all exchange schedules as an indicator of high energy exchange schedules, horizontal power transits and resulting high load flow situations
Notes: LOOK FOR UPDATE Vis concept which simplifies the SLD into a block presentation - somewhat like cartogram with arrows
